name: Mediterranean Chickpea Quinoa Bowl
instructions: Cook quinoa until fluffy, then cool slightly.
Whisk lemon juice, olive oil, oregano, salt, and pepper into a bright dressing.
Combine quinoa, drained chickpeas, spinach, cucumber, and tomatoes.
Fold in crumbled feta and chopped herbs, then drizzle with dressing.
Let the salad sit 5 minutes so the flavors balance before serving.
notes: Keeps well for 2 days; add herbs just before serving for maximum brightness.

name: Citrus Salmon Farro Traybake
instructions: Cook farro until al dente and spread it on a sheet pan.
Toss broccoli and carrot coins with olive oil, garlic, paprika, salt, and pepper; scatter over the farro.
Nestle salmon on top, brush with yogurt, and finish with lemon slices.
Roast at 425°F (220°C) until salmon flakes and vegetables char at the edges.
Finish with chopped dill and a squeeze of lemon.
notes: Swap farro for barley if you want extra chew.

name: Turkey Sweet Potato Skillet
instructions: Sear ground turkey in olive oil with onions, garlic, cumin, and paprika.
Add diced sweet potato, a splash of water, and cover until tender.
Stir in black beans and chopped kale; cook until greens wilt.
Brighten with lime juice and zest, then fold in cilantro.
Serve straight from the skillet with extra lime wedges.
notes: Great with a fried egg on top for breakfast leftovers.

name: Ginger Tofu Veggie Stir-Fry
instructions: Press and cube tofu, then sear it in a hot skillet until golden.
Add sesame oil, minced ginger, and garlic; cook until fragrant.
Toss in vegetables and stir-fry until crisp-tender.
Deglaze with soy sauce and rice vinegar, coating everything evenly.
Serve over warm brown rice and sprinkle with green onion and sesame seeds.
notes: Use frozen stir-fry veggies if you're low on fresh produce.

name: Lentil Greens Pasta
instructions: Simmer lentils with aromatics until just tender.
Build a quick sauce with olive oil, onions, garlic, chili, and tomatoes.
Fold cooked lentils and spinach into the sauce.
Toss with al dente whole-wheat pasta and a splash of balsamic.
Finish with grated parmesan and torn basil.
notes: Great cold the next day—turn it into a pasta salad with extra greens.

name: Greek Yogurt Chicken Wraps
instructions: Grill or pan-sear chicken with olive oil, garlic, and dill; slice thin.
Mix yogurt with lemon juice, zest, salt, and pepper for a quick sauce.
Warm tortillas briefly so they stay pliable.
Layer spinach, sliced cucumber, tomato, onion, and chicken.
Drizzle with yogurt sauce and wrap tightly.
notes: Swap yogurt for hummus if you need a dairy-free option.

name: Shrimp Brown Rice Pilaf
instructions: Toast brown rice in olive oil with minced shallot and paprika.
Add warm broth, cover, and cook until rice is tender.
Stir in diced zucchini and peas during the last 5 minutes.
Sear shrimp separately in a little butter until just pink.
Fold shrimp into the rice, finish with lemon juice and parsley.
notes: Add toasted almonds for crunch if you have them.
